ContactMessage.title: ContactMessage
ContactMessage.description: Represents a message sent through the contact form.

id.description: Unique identifier for the contact message.

name.description: Name of the person sending the message.

sentAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was sent.

definition.description: Collection to store contact messages submitted via the contact form.

params.name: contactMessageId
params.description: Unique identifier for each contact message.

firestore.reasoning: The data structure prioritizes simplicity and security. All contact messages are stored in a single collection, `/contactMessages`. This approach is suitable given the requirements do not specify user-specific messages or different access levels.  The structure avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies by storing all contact messages in a single collection. Since the app does not define any access control requirements on this collection, no denormalization is needed. There are no `list` operation access requirements defined, but all write operations should be checked against abuse.
